column3: Total other-than-temporary impairment (OTTI) losses were $207 million, $136 million and $18 million for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Of total OTTI, losses of $189 million, $183 million and $49 million were recognized in earnings, and losses (reversal of losses) of $18 million, $(47) million and $(31) million were recognized as non-credit-related OTTI in other comprehensive income for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
Includes OTTI losses of $453 million, $376 million and $273 million for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
